title: (x) Monospaced sans printed from Ricoh printer - various {gang}
content:
I need to find the name of this font, for a client. - Or a similar typeface -  
Imposible to find it on internet.  
It was printed from a RICOH printer, maybe its a custom face commisioned for the Ricoh software, i am not sure.  
Any info is helpful, thanks!

mh.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Mono-font-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414163825/http:/typophile.com/files/Mono-font-1.jpg) | 279.15 KB |
author: Miguel Hernandez

comments.content: Looks like some narrow monospaced instance of Helvetica.

You could come close by horizontally scaling [Monospace 821](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414163825/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=BT.816.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Caja+pesos+Santiago&sampleSize=24).

Maybe a little closer with PT Mono Condensed Book.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/mono-condensed/pt-mono-condensed-b...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414163825/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/mono-condensed/pt-mono-condensed-book/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/mono-condensed/pt-mono-condensed-book/")

Cash EF Monospace is another option; it has the right shape for lowercase i, l, etc.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/cash-monospaced/cash-ef-monospace/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414163825/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/cash-monospaced/cash-ef-monospace/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/cash-monospaced/cash-ef-monospace/")
